nistRequirement: a. Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas. b. Maintain accountability of system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas. c. Document activities associated with the transport of system media that contain CUI.

settings.description: Configures sensitivity labels to apply encryption protection to documents and emails containing CUI during transport. Encryption ensures that CUI remains protected even when transported outside controlled areas (via email, cloud storage, or removable media).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Microsoft Purview compliance portal, go to Information Protection > Labels
2. Create or edit a sensitivity label designated for CUI
3. Under Protection settings, select 'Apply or remove encryption'
4. Choose encryption settings: 'Assign permissions now' for predefined permissions
5. Configure permissions: Select users/groups who can access encrypted content
6. Set access rights: Co-Author, Reviewer, Viewer, or custom permissions
7. Set 'User access to content expires': Configure based on organizational policy (e.g., Never or specific duration)
8. For offline access, configure 'Allow offline access' appropriately
9. Save and publish the label
10. Test by applying label to document and sharing externally
11. Verify recipient can only access with proper authentication

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Encryption via sensitivity labels protects CUI during transport by ensuring that only authorized recipients can access the content. This directly addresses the requirement to protect and control system media containing CUI during transport outside controlled areas. Encryption persists regardless of transport method (email, file sharing, removable storage).
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas

settings.description: Enables Office Message Encryption for Exchange Online to protect email messages containing CUI during transport. OME provides end-to-end encryption for emails sent outside the organization, ensuring CUI remains protected during electronic transport.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Verify Azure Information Protection (AIP) is activated for the tenant
2. Connect to Exchange Online PowerShell
3. Run: Test-IRMConfiguration to verify OME prerequisites
4. Enable OME: Set-IRMConfiguration -AzureRMSLicensingEnabled $true
5. In Exchange admin center, go to Mail flow > Rules
6. Create transport rule for OME encryption:
   - Name: 'Encrypt CUI Emails'
   - Apply this rule if: The message contains sensitive information types (configure CUI-related SITs)
   - Do the following: Modify the message security > Apply Office 365 Message Encryption and rights protection > Encrypt
7. Test by sending an email matching the rule criteria to an external address
8. Verify external recipient receives encrypted message with authentication requirement
9. Monitor encrypted message usage via Message Trace

controlMappings.mappingRationale: OME ensures emails containing CUI are encrypted during transport when sent outside controlled areas (external to the organization). This provides cryptographic protection that satisfies the requirement to protect system media during transport. OME works for any recipient, even those without Microsoft 365, ensuring consistent protection.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas

settings.displayName: DLP Policy - Encrypt Emails Containing CUI
settings.description: Configures Data Loss Prevention policy to automatically encrypt email messages containing CUI when transported outside the organization. DLP automatically detects CUI and applies encryption, ensuring protection during transport without user intervention.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Purview compliance portal > Data loss prevention > Policies
2. Create policy: 'Auto-Encrypt CUI in Email'
3. Choose locations: Exchange email
4. Define rules:
   - Condition: Content contains > Sensitive info types (select CUI-relevant types: SSN, ITAR data, etc.)
   - OR: Content contains > Sensitivity labels (select labels for CUI)
   - Advanced rule: Recipient is external
5. Actions: Restrict access or encrypt content > Encrypt email messages
6. User notifications: Configure policy tip warning users about encryption
7. Incident reports: Send alerts to compliance team
8. Set policy mode: Start with 'Test it out with policy tips'
9. Monitor for 1-2 weeks, review DLP reports
10. Switch to enforcement: Turn policy on fully
11. Monitor via DLP Reports and Activity Explorer

controlMappings.mappingRationale: DLP-based automatic encryption ensures that CUI is protected during email transport without relying on users to remember to encrypt. This satisfies the requirement to protect CUI during transport by providing a technical control that enforces encryption when CUI is detected in emails being sent outside controlled areas.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas

settings.displayName: Require TLS for External Email Connections
settings.description: Enforces Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption for all external email connections, ensuring emails are encrypted in transit between mail servers. This provides baseline encryption protection for CUI during email transport.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Exchange admin center (https://admin.exchange.microsoft.com)
2. Navigate to Mail flow > Connectors
3. For outbound connector (Office 365 to partner organization):
   - Click New connector
   - Connection from: Office 365, To: Partner organization
   - Name: 'Outbound TLS Required'
   - Use MX record or specify smart host
   - Security restrictions: 'Always use TLS' (required)
   - Certificate verification: 'Issued by a trusted certificate authority'
4. Create additional connectors for specific partner domains requiring TLS
5. Alternatively, use mail flow rules:
   - Mail flow > Rules > Create rule
   - Apply to messages sent to people outside the organization
   - Do the following: Modify message properties > Set security level to TLS required
6. Test by sending email to external domain and checking message headers for TLS
7. Monitor via Message Trace for TLS connection failures

controlMappings.mappingRationale: TLS provides encryption in transit for email, protecting CUI as it moves between mail servers during transport outside the organization. While OME provides end-to-end encryption, TLS ensures the transport channel itself is encrypted, providing defense-in-depth for email-based media transport.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas

settings.displayName: DLP Audit and Logging for Media Transport
settings.description: Enables comprehensive audit logging of DLP events related to CUI transport activities. Captures detailed records of when CUI-containing files are shared, emailed, or downloaded, providing accountability for media transport activities.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Purview compliance portal > Audit
2. Ensure Unified Audit Log is turned on (required for DLP audit logging)
3. Go to Data loss prevention > Policies
4. For each DLP policy protecting CUI:
   - Edit policy settings
   - Under Advanced DLP rules, ensure 'Send incident reports in email' is enabled
   - Configure recipients: Security team, compliance officers
   - Enable 'Include incident details'
5. Configure Activity explorer:
   - Go to Information Protection > Activity explorer
   - Verify data is being collected for: File copied to removable media, File sent in email, File uploaded to cloud, File shared externally
6. Set up DLP alerts:
   - Go to Alerts > Alert policies
   - Create alerts for high-severity DLP policy matches
7. Create custom audit log search for transport activities:
   - Audit > Search
   - Activities: DLP policy match, File accessed, File downloaded, File shared externally
8. Export audit logs regularly for long-term retention
9. Review Activity Explorer weekly for unusual transport patterns

controlMappings.mappingRationale: DLP auditing and logging provides the accountability and documentation of media transport activities required by NIST 800-171. This satisfies requirements (b) and (c) by maintaining records of when CUI is transported, who transported it, where it went, and what protection was applied. Activity Explorer and audit logs provide the documentation trail.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Maintain accountability of system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas. Document activities associated with the transport of system media that contain CUI.

settings.displayName: Enable Content Explorer for CUI Media Tracking
settings.description: Enables Content Explorer to provide visibility into all CUI-labeled content and its location across the organization. This helps maintain accountability by tracking where CUI media exists and monitoring its movement.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Purview compliance portal > Content explorer
2. Verify 'Content explorer' is enabled (E5 license required)
3. Grant permissions:
   - Go to Microsoft Purview > Permissions
   - Add users to 'Content Explorer Content Viewer' role group (for viewing file details)
   - Add users to 'Content Explorer List Viewer' role group (for viewing summaries only)
4. In Content Explorer, configure filters:
   - Filter by sensitivity labels used for CUI
   - Filter by location: Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive
   - Filter by retention labels if applicable
5. Use Content Explorer to:
   - Identify all CUI-labeled content
   - Track which labels are most used
   - Identify files that may need reclassification
   - Monitor for unusual distribution patterns
6. Export reports regularly for compliance documentation
7. Create custom Power BI reports using Content Explorer data API
8. Review Content Explorer monthly to ensure CUI inventory is accurate

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Content Explorer provides inventory and tracking capabilities for all CUI media, enabling organizations to maintain accountability for CUI location and status. This supports the requirement to maintain accountability of system media during transport by providing a centralized view of all CUI across the organization and its movement patterns.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Maintain accountability of system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas
